au.edu.jcu.v4l4j
Interface FrameGrabber

All Known Implementing Classes:
BGRFrameGrabber, JPEGFrameGrabber, RawFrameGrabber, RGBFrameGrabber, YUVFrameGrabber, YVUFrameGrabber
public interface FrameGrabber

Objects implementing this interface provide methods to capture frames from a VideoDevice. FrameGrabbers are not instantiated directly. Instead, one of the getXXXFrameGrabber() methods must be called on a VideoDevice to obtain one. Requested height and width may be adjusted to the closest supported values. The adjusted width and height can be retrieved by calling getWidth() and getHeight().
A typical FrameGrabber use is as follows:


Bytebuffer b;
//create a new video device
VideoDevice vd = new VideoDevice("/dev/video0");

//Create an instance of FrameGrabber
FrameGrabber f = vd.getRawFrameGrabber(320, 240, 0, 0, 80);
//the framegrabber will use the first image format supported by the device, as returned by
//vd.getDeviceInfo().getFormatList().getNativeFormats().get(0)

//Start the frame capture
f.startCapture();
while (!stop) {
   b= f.getFrame(); //Get a frame
   //frame size is b.limit()
   //do something useful with b
}

//Stop the capture
f.stopCapture();

//Free capture resources and release the FrameGrabber
vd.releaseFrameGrabber();

//release VideoDevice
vd.release();

Once the frame grabber is released with VideoDevice.releaseFrameGrabber(), it can be re-initialised again with one of the getXXXFrameGrabber() methods again. Similarly, when the capture is stopped with stopCapture(), it can be started again with stopCapture() without having to create a new FrameGrabber.

Author:
gilles
See Also:
RawFrameGrabber, JPEGFrameGrabber, RGBFrameGrabber, BGRFrameGrabber, YUVFrameGrabber, YVUFrameGrabber

Method Detail

getImageFormat

ImageFormat getImageFormat()
This method returns the native image format used by this FrameGrabber. The returned format specifies the image format the capture uses.

Returns:
the native image format used by this FrameGrabber.
Throws:
StateException - if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

setFrameInterval

void setFrameInterval(int num,
                      int denom)
                      throws InvalidValue
This method sets the frame interval used for capture. The frame interval defined the lapse of time (in second) between two captured frames and is the inverse of the frame rate. It may or may not be supported by the underlying hardware/driver. If not supported, calling this method throws a UnsupportedMethod exception. This method will throw an InvalidValue exception if the given frame interval value is not supported. As a guide, you can check the ResolutionInfo objects associated with the video device to find out whether frame intervals are at all supported, and if they are, what values (or range of values) is accepted. ResolutionInfo objects can be obtained for each ImageFormat. See the ImageFormat and ResolutionInfo documentation for more information.

Parameters:
num - the numerator of the frame interval to be set
denom - the denominator of the frame interval to be set
Throws:
UnsupportedMethod - if setting the frame interval is not supported.
InvalidValue - if the given frame interval value is invalid.
StateException - if capture is ongoing (the frame interval must be set when not capturing), or if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

getFrameInterval

FrameInterval.DiscreteInterval getFrameInterval()
This method returns the current frame interval used for capture. It may or may not be supported by the underlying hardware/driver. If not supported, calling this method throws a UnsupportedMethod exception.

Throws:
UnsupportedMethod - if setting the frame interval is not supported.
StateException - if capture is ongoing (the frame interval must be queried when not capturing), or if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

getTuner

Tuner getTuner()
               throws NoTunerException
This method returns the Tuner associated with the input of this FrameGrabber, or throws a NoTunerException if there is none.

Returns:
the Tuner object associated with the chosen input.
Throws:
NoTunerException - if the selected input does not have a tuner
StateException - if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

startCapture

void startCapture()
                  throws V4L4JException
This method starts the capture. After this call, frames can be retrieved with getFrame().

Throws:
V4L4JException - if the capture cant be started
StateException - if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore

getFrame

java.nio.ByteBuffer getFrame()
                             throws V4L4JException
This method retrieves one frame from the video source. The ByteBuffer limit() is set to the size of the captured frame. Note that the returned ByteBuffer is not backed by an array. This is a JNI limitation (not v4l4j).

Returns:
a ByteBuffer containing frame data.
Throws:
V4L4JException - if there is an error capturing from the source.
StateException - if the capture has not been started or if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

stopCapture

void stopCapture()
This method stops the capture.

Throws:
StateException - if the capture has not been started or if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

getHeight

int getHeight()
This method returns the actual height of captured frames.

Returns:
the height
Throws:
StateException - if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

getWidth

int getWidth()
This method returns the actual width of captured frames.

Returns:
the width
Throws:
StateException - if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

getChannel

int getChannel()
This method returns the video channel used to capture frames.

Returns:
the channel
Throws:
StateException - if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.

getStandard

int getStandard()
This method returns the actual video standard: V4L4JConstants.STANDARD_NTSC, V4L4JConstants.STANDARD_PAL , V4L4JConstants.STANDARD_SECAM or V4L4JConstants.STANDARD_WEBCAM

Returns:
the video standard
Throws:
StateException - if this FrameGrabber has been already released, and therefore must not be used anymore.
